channel.title: Links on Underkube
channel.description: Recent content in Links on Underkube

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Jan 5 - 18, 2026)
item.description: I missed last week’s post because I was too busy trying to beat my high score in UEFI Zaxxon. To make it up to you, here is a double-sized roundup covering the last two weeks. Cloud & Kubernetes ðŸ”— Kubernetes Dashboard Archiving - A discussion in the Kubernetes SIG-UI group regarding the potential archiving of the Kubernetes Dashboard project. Ingress Controllers Spreadsheet - A comprehensive, community-maintained spreadsheet comparing various Kubernetes Ingress Controllers.

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Dec 29, 2025 - Jan 4, 2026)
item.description: I’ve gathered a fresh batch of links to kick off the new year, ranging from Kubernetes networking and BSD tools to security talks from the 39C3 congress. Cloud, BSD & Infrastructure ðŸ”— Kubernetes Egress Control with Squid / Hacker News Discussion: A guide on using Squid proxy to control egress traffic in Kubernetes clusters. BSD Tools Collection: A collection of BSD utilities including mfsBSD & mfslinux (minimal memory-based distributions), miniBSD (small footprint FreeBSD), and occambsd (an application of Occam’s razor to FreeBSD).

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Dec 22 - 28, 2025)
item.description: Here is the roundup of links for this week: Cloud & Infrastructure ðŸ”— Debusine Repositories Launch / Main Page: Debian introduces Debusine, a new PPA-like system allowing developers to publish add-on packages with integrated builds and testing. PCI Passthrough in Harvester - A guide on setting up AMD GPUs in Harvester with PCI passthrough. Password Agents - Documentation from systemd.io regarding the implementation and use of Password Agents. DevOps & Tools ðŸ”— Snitch - A tool to inspect network connections in a cleaner, more visual way than standard utilities.

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Dec 15 - 21, 2025)
item.description: Here is the roundup of links for this week: Cloud & Infrastructure ðŸ”— Kubernetes v1.35 Release - The official announcement for the latest version of Kubernetes. Docker Hardened Images / Catalog: Docker has made its catalog of hardened container images free to use, designed to secure the software supply chain. Why you can’t ping a Kubernetes Service - A technical explanation of why standard ICMP pings don’t work with K8s ClusterIP services.

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Dec 8 - 14, 2025)
item.description: Here is the roundup of links for this week: Cloud & Infrastructure ðŸ”— IBM to acquire Confluent - Major industry news as IBM announces its acquisition of the data streaming platform Confluent. Netvisor - An open-source observability agent for Kubernetes that provides visibility into cluster traffic and network calls. Kubeterm - A graphical terminal specifically designed for managing Kubernetes clusters. Ingress Nginx Migration / GitHub Repo: A tool to assist in migrating from the Nginx Ingress Controller to Traefik.

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Dec 1 - 7, 2025)
item.description: Here is the list of links for this week: Cloud & Infrastructure ðŸ”— AWS re:Invent 2025 - Keynote with Dr. Werner Vogels - The annual keynote from Amazon’s CTO, covering the latest in cloud technology and the “Renaissance Developer”. MinIO is now maintenance mode - Discussion on Reddit regarding the change in development status for the popular object storage server. FreeBSD 15.0-RELEASE Announcement - The latest stable release of the FreeBSD operating system.

item.title: What Edu is Reading This Week (Nov 23-30 2025)
item.description: What Edu is Reading This Week ðŸ”—« This space for rent » :D AI, LLMs & Automation ðŸ”— Model Context Protocol (MCP) Introduction: Documentation for the Model Context Protocol, an open standard designed to enable AI agents (LLMs) to interact securely and predictably with external tools, APIs, and data. Jules: The Autonomous Agent CLI Extension / Jules in 90 seconds / Jules GitHub Repo: The official page (and a GitHub repository for a Gemini extension) of Jules, an asynchronous coding sidekick, letting developers delegate long-running tasks.

item.title: What Edu is Reading This Week (Nov 17-23 2025)
item.description: What Edu is Reading This Week ðŸ”—Plenty of content this week! Cloud Native & Kubernetes ðŸ”— Tuning Linux Swap for Kubernetes: A deep-dive article on why and how to correctly configure and tune Linux swap settings when running Kubernetes workloads. Production-Grade Container Deployment with Podman Quadlets: How to deploy and manage containers using Podman and Quadlets, which leverage native systemd unit files for production-ready setups. Security Contexts in Kubernetes: A breakdown of Kubernetes Security Contexts, covering settings like runAsUser, capabilities, and SELinux options to tighten pod security.

item.title: What Edu is Reading This Week (Nov 10-16 2025)
item.description: What Edu is Reading This Week ðŸ”—Fifth week in a row! Cloud Native & Kubernetes ðŸ”— Ingress-Nginx Controller Retirement (K8s Blog): Official announcement regarding the planned retirement and deprecation of the classic ingress-nginx controller, signaling the industry shift toward the Gateway API. ingress2gateway: A tool from the Kubernetes SIGs to automatically migrate existing Ingress resources to the newer, more powerful Kubernetes Gateway API. Helm Documentation Overview: The official overview page for Helm 4, the package manager for Kubernetes that announced its 4.

item.title: What Edu is reading this week (Oct 20 - 26, 2025)
item.description: Another week goes by! Software & DevOps ðŸ”— Uber Kraken - A P2P-powered Docker registry developed by Uber, designed for highly scalable and available image distribution. Xpra - Persistent remote applications for X11, MacOS, and MS Windows, known as “screen for X,” allowing disconnection and reconnection to graphical applications. pkgit - An unconventional package manager designed to compile and install packages directly from their git repository. volare - A Kubernetes volume populator project.

item.title: What Edu is Reading This Week (Oct 13-19 2025)
item.description: What Edu is Reading This Week ðŸ”—People often ask me about the cool stuff I stumble upon during the week. So, I figured, why not share the links that caught my eye? So here we are. This is inspired by some newsletters I read such as Vermandeen’s Valuable News or Kube Today. I’m not 100% sure if I’ll be able to keep a weekly cadence; I really don’t have too much free time lately, but I’ll try!
